abstract.p: DDB Worldwide in New York is merging its worldwide interactive agencies into one unit, Tribal DDB Worldwide (S)

block.p: DDB Worldwide in New York is merging its worldwide interactive agencies into one unit called Tribal DDB Worldwide, based in New York.

The new unit, which focuses on online marketing, consulting and Web engineering, combines the following DDB divisions: DDB Digital in Hong Kong, New York, Singapore and Sydney; BMP InterAction in London; E-scape/Generator in Copenhagen; DDB Interactive in Paris; DDB Interactive in Madrid; and Heye New Media in Munich. It currently has 500 employees working out of 21 offices in 15 countries for clients like Exxon Mobil, PepsiCo and Volkswagen.
DDB Worldwide in New York is merging its worldwide interactive agencies into one unit called Tribal DDB Worldwide, based in New York.

The new unit, which focuses on online marketing, consulting and Web engineering, combines the following DDB divisions: DDB Digital in Hong Kong, New York, Singapore and Sydney; BMP InterAction in London; E-scape/Generator in Copenhagen; DDB Interactive in Paris; DDB Interactive in Madrid; and Heye New Media in Munich. It currently has 500 employees working out of 21 offices in 15 countries for clients like Exxon Mobil, PepsiCo and Volkswagen.

The unit will be run on a worldwide basis by a management team called the office of the chairman: Matt Freeman, 30, chief executive at DDB Digital in New York, becomes chief executive for North America at Tribal DDB; Johnny Henriksen, 34, managing director for Rapp Collins Denmark in Copenhagen, part of the Rapp Collins Worldwide unit of the Omnicom Group, becomes chief executive for Europe; and John Zeigler, 46, continues as director for digital strategy at DDB Worldwide in New York.
Tribal DDB is more than 80 percent owned by DDB Worldwide, part of Omnicom. Rapp Collins will work with Tribal DDB on direct marketing and database services in Europe.
